Reviews.Title: A basic texting phone with *very* limited Internet capability.
Reviews.Author: Tech Guy
Reviews.Content: I've been a VM customer for years. I rarely use my personal phone and have built up a substantial credit balance just by paying the minimum top-up every 90 days.I upgraded to the LG200 because of the keypad and email capability. The phone looks good and has a nice feel. It's about the same size as an iPhone 4, just a bit thicker. I'm using an iPhone pouch type case and it fits fine.The VM LG200 makes calls and sends texts as you might expect. This review is mainly about the email capability.The phone has a (downloadable) Java based email client. It has presets for Yahoo,  AOL, Windows Live, and Gmail. It can also handle POP and IMAP accounts.I have two Gmail accounts and set up one with the Gmail preset, this was easy. I set up the 2nd Gmail account using IMAP settings. Both work fine. Basically you are limited to 50 of your most recent inbox messages. You get charged the SMS rate when reading or sending a message. There is no charge for synching--so just viewing your inbox (sender and part of the subject) does not incur a charge. The email client is very basic, for example, there is no obvious way to delete a draft message.Bottom line:It's fine for sending and receiving short email messages and texts. Expect nothing more.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Phone For Talking And Texting.
Reviews.Author: Swen
Reviews.Content: I decided to drop the BIG carriers after using them for over 8 years. I was paying on average over those years around 80 a month, since 08 or so with the newer data plans that monthly payment became 100+.So the only reason I even came across the LG 200 was because I was at first looking for pre-paid cell services. I eventually came across Virgin and their [[1500 minutes/1500 texts]] plan for $30. IT CAN'T BE BEAT. So I then looked at the phones they had available. The LG 200 was one of the few they had that I found. There was a more expensive phone with the slide keyboards which I hate, then a cheaper similar one to the 200 that was shorter but it had horrible ratings for keyboard use, and being I text a lot, about 75% text/25% talk, this was important.I just received my LG 200 I bought through Verizon, so even though I am not a verified buyer with this item you can check out the case I bought for this phone which is verified and my review of it which is one of the most recent at, "Krusell Gaia Slim Leather Pouch for iPhone 4." Or just click on my name and see the latest reviews I've left. This case works perfect for the LG 200, so being there are none made for this phone currently that are specific to it, you might want to grab yourself one.The LG 200-THE PROS:1.Comfortable and easy to use keyboard.2.Awesome sound quality and strength, both earpiece and speakerphone.3.Great battery life, quick charge.4.Light yet doesn't feel cheap. Love the look.THE CONS:1.Camera quality sucks.2.Web browsing is ???3.Display lighting dimmer than most ???4&5.No MP3 player/No Video player(Good! Finally a phone that is made for talking and texting)For the cons it doesn't matter. I DON'T use this phone for taking pictures or surfing the web, I use it ONLY for talking and texting. And the display dimness I don't see, these are the five main complaints with this phone from other reviews on the web so I thought I would list them.This IS NOT a smartphone. It is not for taking pictures, listening to music or watching videos. It's a good quality, good looking cell for TALKING and TEXTING. Simple. I love it. I've been so sick of extra features I don't want on cellphones. I have a Kodak pocket cam and a Canon camcorder for taking videos and pictures, if you need music on the run then buy yourself an iPod or something. Who needs internet on their phone? As a decktop pc guy I never understood this.I needed a phone to talk and text, the LG 200 exceeds those needs. Will be recommending this phone and Virgin plan to everyone I know who is in a good coverage area.

Reviews.Title: If you want paylo
Reviews.Author: ** Maine Payne ** "ARTISTICTY"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone because I wanted a fairly advanced phone that was compatible with the pay-lo plan.I sometimes had a problem with delayed text messages, I would occasionally receive a text about 1 hour after the person had sent it. Also, about 1 in 5 times while trying to get on the internet, I would receive a connection error message which really annoyed me.The number one reason I sent this phone back, was because after about 4 weeks, the phone stopped charging. I would plug it into the charger and nothing would happen. I babyed my phone and charger so it was in perfect condition and there was no reason for this to be happening.Other than that, this is a pretty good phone if you like to text alot.pros:Downlodable javatexting is very easyclear phone conversationsgreat battery lifeemail is easyhas other features such as notepad, and an event calenderdurable bodycons:no mp3 player/ no way to play musicno way to connect phone to your computerlimited internet capability (some sites don't work at all)camera quality is really bad (only 640x480)cant watch ANY kind of video on itno obvious way to view attachments in text messages (such as pictures)Remember, this is not a smartphone, it's very basic. Great for texting, talking and email. You get internet too, but don't expect the best out of it.If you're on a small budget and are aiming for the virgin mobile $30 pay-lo plan, then this phone would be your best bet.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Babs "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: A more advanced phone than I had; took me awhile to get used to it but happy I chose this phone.  It's many features asre fun to discover.  No contract is the way to go for me.

Reviews.Title: Good basic phone
Reviews.Author: Comgirl "Comgirl"
Reviews.Content: Good basic phone if you want a reasonably priced plan ($30 a month on pay-lo for 1500 minutes of text plus 1500 minutes of talk  per month). Great for texting. Nothing too fancy when it comes to the other features, but it gets the job done and is easy to carry around. I got this for my teenage niece for her birthday. She loves it but wishes there were more case options out there for it. My brother loves it because it is a reasonably priced plan that still allows his daughter access to lots of text and talk minutes on a pretty nice phone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Maribeth
Reviews.Content: We are very, very happy with this phone.  It was a birthday present for my son and he is very satisfied and happy with his gift! He couldn't of asked for a better phone because this is the exact phone he kept asking for.  He wanted a phone WITHOUT a touch screen, but a nice, sharp screen.  He got what he wanted and it was shipped out INCREDIBLY FAST! Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: Solid phone for the money
Reviews.Author: Daniel Harris
Reviews.Content: I purchased to replace my previous Virgin Mobile phone was a kyocera. I was never pleased with that one for numerous reasons. The LG seems better made, gets better reception and in general is a superior phone. Good buy.

Reviews.Title: Battery leaked out after only 9 months
Reviews.Author: ARegan220
Reviews.Content: I liked the basic talk & text phone except I feel the phone & battery should have at least made it a year without any problems.  However, that was not the case with this phone.

Reviews.Title: really good phone
Reviews.Author: joyce merritt
Reviews.Content: I bought this thinking it was a slider but it turns out to be easier than the the slider. It helps with texting and dialing. Great phone

Reviews.Title: product review
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: Product works perfectly so far and has a lot more options than the other phones at this price. i am happy that i bought this product and would highly recommend it for others who want a simply phone to operate.

Reviews.Title: works better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Lydia Heyward
Reviews.Content: The keys are kind of close together for someone with arthritis in the hands, but the younger kids find it easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Not  what I expected
Reviews.Author: P.
Reviews.Content: Some of the amenties that the phone offered are don't work and it is a discontinued product. Therefore, I have a product that only does the bare necessities and no more no less.

Reviews.Title: Good Option
Reviews.Author: Joan  H.
Reviews.Content: Good option for a low cost phone.  Although buttons are small, the numbers in yellow stand-out and are fairly easy to press.  Easy to enter contacts.

Reviews.Title: phone
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: The ordering and shipping was fast and painless, the phone seems to work great our daughter rarely used her old phone and now she is texting and calling us more so it has goods and bads!

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: dottikins
Reviews.Content: I've had the LG 200 for a little over a year now, which means I can give a fair-minded review of the product.PROS-- amazing battery life. Seriously, this has the longest lasting battery of any phone I've ever owned or even heard of: after a year, a full charge will last about two weeks! Granted, I pretty much only text and talk very sparingly, never go online, but that is still very impressive standby time. I started keeping track of how long the batter lasts -- so far, I was able to go two weeks and three days (17 days) between charging.-- I bought this phone because I'm primarily a texter: 95% texting, 5% talking. The qwerty keyboard is comfortable and great for texting. The best feature, hands down.-- it's pretty hardy. I don't have a case for it, and I've dropped a few times. Once, from waist height onto a hard ceramic floor, the cover popped off and I was sure the phone was done for: nope, it was fine.-- good call clarity. Again, I don't talk much, but the phone works great at all phone functions: calling, texting, not dying after slipping out of your hands.CONS-- camera is pretty bad. The pics are only decent in full sunlight or a bright room. Also, only way to get them off your phone is to picture text them to someone.-- NOT A SMARTPHONE. This phone doesn't even pretend to it, so don't get it if you want anything above calling and texting.

Reviews.Title: A very simple and easy  phone
Reviews.Author: twoz
Reviews.Content: The price is right, nothing complicated here. Works well sounds good, keys are small but functional.  I'd recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what we needed
Reviews.Author: Kathi Lynn Morgan
Reviews.Content: Phone is perfect, no problems.  It fits the need for what we wanted in a cell phone.  Shipping was fast and nicely packaged.  Completely satisfied..thanks!

Reviews.Title: Cool Phone.
Reviews.Author: cherryg
Reviews.Content: I got this phone yesterday and i is really cool, Sure its not a smart phone, but it does its job of calling annd texting.The phone came fast, and I used standered shipping, I can go on the internet, and facebook, which is really cool.

Reviews.Title: meets all of my expectations
Reviews.Author: Carol Feeney
Reviews.Content: I am not a phone talker or in to all of the technology that most people seem to think is a must have but, in this day and age I think a cell phone is almost a neccessary tool for convenience & safety.  My LG LG200 fits all of my needs & goes beyond them, I haven't had any problems, easy to use (even for me), the price was right.  I'm very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone! :)
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Aiello
Reviews.Content: I Like this phone! Very cute and great to text.  Do u like this phone? Nice Screen, Other things too, Don't know how to make Numbers On This Baby.  Nice screen and all the things.

Reviews.Title: Terribly flimsy and fragile
Reviews.Author: larrytolefson
Reviews.Content: terrible product. on it's 3rd day of service it failed to survive a fall of about a foot and a half - ONTO GRASS! warranty department will NOT stand behind it's products but will offer to fix your $70 for around $100. really crumby. i'd advise to steer clear.

ProductInfo.Features:
2.2" QCIF LCD screen for viewing the web, email, and more
Bluetooth 3.0
2.5 mm headset jack for connecting headsets and earphones
Offering a strong balance of functionality and affordability
What's in the Box: LG LG200 smartphone, li-ion battery, combo charger, user manual
ProductInfo.Name: LG  LG200 Prepaid Phone (payLo by Virgin Mobile)
